page.title: 18SKENE ESTATE (CONTINUED)
page.content: The Estate was passed to a daughter, {Lady Jane Hamilton}since there was no son to inherit the title.She was married to Captain Farquharson;he was wealthy and owned considerable land in the area.They never occupied Skene House.Captain Farquharson has never owned the Estate but is held in trust for the Hamiltons.The present Lady Hamilton has just died,June 1985,and so the house and lands will pass to her two daughters. Since World War II,the Estate has been slowly broken up due to the lack of money.The farms on the Estate were sold to the sitting tenants;those men who originally farmed the land for the Laird.{Skene House}has not been maintained and is now derelict;even the gardens are now used for farming.
